known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Current system requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and does not support automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation

known_issues.title: Discrepancy Between Leave Policy and Payroll Settings Daily Wage Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave. The system intentionally allows payroll configuration to take precedence, with leave policy formulas displayed as greyed out to indicate they are not active. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms. Users cannot easily understand why formulas are greyed out or how payroll settings supersede leave policy configurations.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules. Manual alignment is required.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Leap Year Day Counting in EOS Gratuity Calculator
known_issues.issue_explanation: The End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculator does not correctly account for leap years, specifically using 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, which results in an incorrect total service period and gratuity amount calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in the EOS gratuity calculator's ability to dynamically handle leap year calculations.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: Daily wage calculation for pro-rated End of Service (EOS) amounts is producing consistently incorrect results with small decimal point discrepancies. The system calculates (basic + allowances / 30) but shows amounts less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation causing systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential product gap in financial calculation precision, specifically in pro-rated salary computations requiring enhanced rounding and decimal handling.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation (AED 231,821) slightly differs from manual calculation (AED 252,485), with support confirming system calculation's accuracy based on specific service duration and daily wage formula.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Potential minor calculation differences between system and manual calculations

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Day
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle February 29th in leap years, causing minor differences in total service days and resulting gratuity amount. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation showed 913 days by including the leap year day.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Detailed Gratuity Calculation Logic Mismatch
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation methodology differs from manual calculations, specifically in handling partial years above 5 years of service and leap year day counting. The calculation involves segmenting service periods, applying different daily rates (21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year above 5 years), and using specific divisors (366 for leap years, 365 for non-leap years) for partial year calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation logic is complex and not transparently communicated, leading to potential misunderstandings about how partial years and leap years are processed.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for more detailed, user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic with worked examples showing service duration calculation for partial years and leap year handling.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Worked in Gratuity Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates one extra day in job tenure (622 vs 623 days), potentially impacting gratuity calculation accuracy. The platform captures 623 days instead of 622 days when computing years worked.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Minor discrepancy in days worked calculation can lead to slight variations in gratuity amount
known_issues.gap_statement: Precise day counting mechanism may need refinement to ensure exact job tenure calculation

known_issues.title: Discrepancy in Leave Salary Calculation Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on a fixed daily rate configuration in policy, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days. The specific case involved dividing daily wage by 30 days instead of 31 days, resulting in a slight salary calculation difference (2940 SAR vs expected 2988 SAR).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations that may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including daily rate divisor configurations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Monthly leave salary accruals vary due to changing working days per month
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using different daily wage configurations with independent divisors (30 days vs 30.42 days), causing calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration use separate daily wage formulas that cannot be automatically aligned without manual configuration.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method that consistently applies across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

known_issues.title: Salary Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood the daily wage proration calculation. The system was correctly calculating based on working days, with the specific work week configuration determining the total working days (in this case, all 7 days were configured as working days for NVK Operations).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration calculation depends entirely on work week configuration, which may not align with typical calendar day expectations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. The system only correctly prorates salaries when departure dates are in the past, creating a calculation logic error.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates during payroll processing.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in handling dynamic proration scenarios for employees with departure dates differing from payroll processing date.

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Modification
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes out of sync between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules, preventing automatic recalculation when public holidays are added after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for module communication enhancement to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across system configurations.

known_issues.title: Daily Wage Calculation Produces Unexpected Deduction Amounts
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can result in deduction amounts that differ from the expected monthly salary.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses 30.42 days divisor, not calendar days
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect daily rate remarks for February, showing 31 days instead of 29 days (leap year), despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods. This means the daily wage for unpaid leave is calculated using a system-wide setting instead of policy-level configurations, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month when leave occurred.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate is recalculated based on payroll processing month rather than stored from leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for consistent daily rate display that preserves initially calculated rate at leave request time

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is currently based on a 26 working days per month standard (365 annual days - 52 weekly offs = 313 working days / 12 months = 26.08 days)
limitations.impact: Manual intervention required for variations in employee working days

limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator settings take precedence over leave policy formulas for unpaid leave calculations. The leave policy formula is greyed out and cannot be applied directly.

limitations.title: Salary Config Change Impact on Leave Deductions

limitations.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method

limitations.title: Ambiguity in Service Days Counting
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear methodology for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are incorporated
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity calculations

limitations.title: Opaque Gratuity Calculation Process

limitations.impact: Potential user confusion and manual calculation discrepancies

limitations.title: Leave Encashment Daily Wage Calculation Constraint

limitations.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors.

limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration is only accurate when departure dates are in the past, failing for future departure dates.

limitations.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling in Leave Transactions

limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.

limitations.limitation_statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for calculating daily wages, which may not align with calendar months

limitations.title: February Leap Year Day Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations must use the actual number of calendar days in a month, with special handling for February in leap years (29 days).
limitations.impact: Ensures accurate unpaid leave deductions based on precise calendar days

limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate calculated as Basic + Allowances / Working Days, excluding public holidays
